descriptions: The student does not attempt to draw the polygon or the drawing is completely inaccurate.
The student attempts to draw the polygon, but the drawing contains significant errors in vertices or sides.
The student draws a polygon with some inaccuracies, such as misplacing one or two vertices or misrepresenting side lengths.
The student mostly accurately draws the polygon with minor errors that do not significantly affect the shape.
The student accurately draws the polygon with correct vertices and sides, but may have very minor cosmetic issues.
The student draws the polygon flawlessly, demonstrating a clear understanding of coordinate plane geometry.
The student does not attempt to calculate side lengths or uses an entirely incorrect method.
The student attempts to calculate side lengths, but the calculations are fundamentally flawed and incorrect.
The student calculates some side lengths correctly, but makes errors in other calculations.
The student calculates most side lengths correctly, with only minor errors in calculation.
The student accurately calculates all side lengths using coordinates, showing a strong understanding of the coordinate plane.
The student calculates all side lengths accurately and efficiently, demonstrating a deep understanding of the coordinate plane and its properties.
The student does not attempt to apply polygon drawing or length calculation to real-world problems.
The student attempts to apply polygon drawing or length calculation to real-world problems, but the application is illogical or irrelevant.
The student makes a weak connection between polygon drawing/length calculation and real-world problems.
The student applies polygon drawing and length calculation to real-world problems with some relevance, but the connection could be stronger.
The student applies polygon drawing and length calculation effectively to solve real-world problems, demonstrating a solid understanding of their practical applications.
The student demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of how polygon drawing and length calculation can be used to model and solve complex real-world problems.
